frameDefinitions: An Experiencer feels bad about a choice, an Action, or a failure to do something, which they now consider to have been a mistake or wrong.
A Perpetrator (generally intentionally) commits a Crime, i.e. does something not permitted by the laws of society.
In this frame an Evaluee is described by a (usually implicit)
This frame covers words for Body_part(s) (BP) belonging to a Possessor (Poss), which may be characterized by a Descriptor (Desc).

A new Employee obtains a Position with an Employer, with which there are certain Tasks associated; in exchange for the performance of these Tasks, the Employee receives Compensation from the Employer.
A Wrongdoer engages in a Misdeed.
frameExamples: Smithers did not <t>repent</t> of his crime.
They <t>perpetrated</t> a felony by substituting a lie for negotiations.
That was very <t>righteous</t> of you to help him.
He had to brace his right <t><fex name='Body_part'>arm</fex></t> against his leg in order to fight the roll.
I <t>signed</t> <t>on</t> with YouTube to make them a new GUI.
You have <t>sinned</t> for the last time, Stephen!
listRoleDefinitions: The role <fen>Experiencer</fen> indicates the person who experiences the emotion about their prior action.
The role <fen>Action</fen> marks expressions that indicate a prior action that the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has come to feel bad about.
The role <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a gesture or body part which is displaying the <fen>Emotional_state</fen> of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The role <fen>Emotional_state</fen> is modified by an adjective  that indicates the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is contrite.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> or the <fen>Expressor</fen> is contrite.
The individual that commits a <fen>Crime</fen>.
An act, generally intentional, that has been formally forbidden by law.
When the <fen>Crime</fen> was committed.
The location where the <fen>Crime</fen> occurs.
This is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Behavior</fen>.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which is the basis of the evaluation of morality.
This Frame Element denotes the <fen>Possessor</fen> of the <fen>Body_part</fen>.
This Frame Element  is the <fen>Body_part</fen>.
The person who enters an employment relation with an <fen>Employer</fen>.
The person (or institution) that the <fen>Employee</fen> enters an employment relationship with.
The label given to a particular type of employment.
The action that the <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to do for the <fen>Employer</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an <fen>Employee</fen> signs on with an <fen>Employer</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Employee</fen> enteres an employment relationship with an <fen>Employer</fen>.
This is the person whose <fen>Misdeed</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
The time at which a <fen>Misdeed</fen> is performed.
The location where a <fen>Misdeed</fen> occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Smithers</fex> was contrite about his wrongdoings.
They confessed and repented <fex>their actions against the Soviet Union</fex>.
Repentant <fex>tears</fex> welled to his eyes.
Martha had a guilty <fex>conscience</fex> after selling inferior merchandise.
How can <fex>he</fex> commit treason against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?
How can he commit <fex>treason</fex> against the King of England in a foreign country , if he is not English?
A murder perpetrated <fex>at 1:08AM this morning</fex> was not investigated until noon today.
We have jurisdiction over crimes committed <fex>in Woodside County</fex>.
It was honorable <fex>of Jackie</fex> to give up the position.
<fex>Accepting that money</fex> was immoral of Lindsay.
His face twisted into an evil <fex>grin</fex>
<fex>Kim's</fex> arm is broken.
Kim's <fex>arm</fex> is broken.
In spring of 1983, <fex>Tom</fex> signed on at the historic Wawona Hotel in Yosemite National Park, and continues to perform there nightly in the hotel's piano parlor.
He later played for the Scottish Claymores of the NFL Europe League in the spring of 2001, then signed on <fex>with Baltimore</fex> in July of 2001.

In 1973 Franco Acerbis signed on <fex>as a mechanic for the Italian enduro
team</fex>.
In the end, however, Gaskill opted to remain out West and signed on <fex>to play Oscar Marone on CBS's The Bold and the Beautiful</fex>.
Things have been very busy with the new job since I signed on <fex>in June, 2001</fex>.
I had signed on <fex>right there</fex> with the rest of the freaks.
The misdeeds <fex>of the previous evening</fex> were all forgotten now.
Sexual peccadilloes <fex>in the White House</fex> are one thing, lying before Congress quite another.
